intro: Trianthema crystallinum f. obscurum, commonly known as the dark-leaved crystalline sandmat, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to harsh environments. The plant features dense, dark green foliage with a waxy coating that helps reduce water loss. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically pale yellow or white, blooming in spring. This variety is distinguished by its darker leaf coloration compared to the typical form of Trianthema crystallinum.
